name: Udame
description: A windswept fishing town on the eastern coast. The locals are suspicious of anyone who doesn't smell like salt and regret.

name: Righteous
description: Named by its founders, who were deeply wrong about themselves. A self-important town that holds a festival every other week for no clear reason.

name: Pilbur
description: A quiet farming town that smells faintly of hay and overconfidence. The pigs here are the size of ponies and twice as opinionated.

name: Atrium
description: A sprawling city built inside the ruins of something far more impressive. Nobody knows what, and the locals prefer it that way.

name: Orabu
description: A merchant city perched at the crossroads of four trade routes. If it can be bought, it's here. If it can't, someone is already forging it.

name: Oakhaven
description: A tidy lumber town with suspiciously well-organized woodpiles and a carpenter who will absolutely tell you about them.

name: Ironspire
description: An industrial city of forges and fumes, where the air tastes like ambition and metal shavings. The workers here don't stop — ever.

name: Mistralis
description: An elven-influenced city forever wrapped in low fog. Beautiful, if you like that sort of thing. The locals insist the fog is 'atmospheric', not a problem.

name: Dusklight
description: A sleepy village known for its particularly good inn and particularly bad sense of urgency. The perfect place to deliver a meal and stay for three days.

name: Thalassa Port
description: The largest port on the continent. Ships from everywhere, sailors from nowhere in particular, and enough taverns to lose a week in without trying.

name: Glimmerhold
description: A mountain town nestled in a valley that catches light strangely in the morning. The chef here is famed for asking impossible errands in exchange for a meal.

name: Vaelin's Reach
description: A lonely outpost at the edge of the known map. The garrison here has four soldiers, two very large dogs, and a disturbing amount of paperwork.

name: Cinderpeak
description: Built on the slope of a dormant volcano. The residents insist it is dormant. There is some disagreement on the definition of 'dormant'.

name: Solstice
description: The beating heart of the known world. Enormous, noisy, and always at least a little on fire somewhere. If you can't find it in Solstice, you don't need it.

name: Briarwatch
description: A small village famous for watching the briar. Nobody is sure what they are watching for, but the locals take turns and seem satisfied.

name: The High Spire
description: A towering pinnacle of stone that pierces the clouds. Ancient and mysterious, it stands as a monument to something—or perhaps a warning about something.
